channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: Best “friend of Jews” former president endorses antisemite. https://t.co/1xM4azPY8M
This is the future Republicans want. https://t.co/XI2zsV8yG8
Damn. Chitty Chitty Bang Bang lied. Another childhood myth shattered. https://t.co/H7gsAFjfPG
@KurtBusiek Which film?
Is there indeed an increase in heart attacks among 30 and 40 something men in Lakewood? Can it indeed be detected through screening? And is it a post-covid syndrome? https://t.co/cbinsellWz
Your occasional reminder that Twitter is not all that great at ad targeting. But maybe you’ve been asking this question which has not been keeping *me* up at night. https://t.co/fOBauiXkAa
Wowza! https://t.co/tMf4jN3uuM

@dzkalman Constructive theology is effectively dead.
@dzkalman When and how and why it died is an interesting question worth exploring.
Funny how covid killed more people than crime in 2021 and we’re talking about crime. https://t.co/b2MlRgp516
@TheRaDR Sounds Jewish but OK. https://t.co/v3WcozxpDm
@rmneiss Seems suspicious. Probably wise to call in a drone strike out of an abundance of caution.
@rmneiss And how did that work for you?
@SethCotlar Wouldn’t using Second Amendment freedoms to fight unelected tyrants be the bipartisan approach here?

@SethCotlar Can’t help but think that a fair amount of unexamined racism by people who grew up in the segregation era is at play here.
@SethCotlar Increasingly thinking that while a retirement age of 65 or 70 for political leaders is ideal, the Logan’s Run approach is a decent compromise.

@EladNehorai They think they can avoid conflict if they just shut up. Their public execution during the second Trump Administration is the only bright spot in the American dystopia they are empowering.
@SvePan1108 @HamptonStevens @Brennanator @ChrisMurphyCT But “Republicans” are good.
This. It is crazy making, to say the least. https://t.co/ET9ItyxipR

Shouldn’t it be a bigger deal that Republicans are the pro-covid party? https://t.co/1Swl9JBRiT
Maybe that should be the Speaker’s message, rather than nostalgia for the good old days?
We have one party that is pro-covid, and one party that has been bullied into not fighting the other party.
Utterly clueless. All that matters is what the current #RogueSCOTUS believes — unless you’re willing to advocate expanding or contracting the court’s membership. https://t.co/XawWyUwqAh
If you’re a fundamentalist, you’ll believe God will ultimately settle all the accounts so mothers dying in childbirth really isn’t all that bad. https://t.co/NqAeyFZJoT
@brianbeutler What’s your theory? Old and out of touch and unable to adapt? Or desperately hoping to avoid a show trial and public execution under the next Republican administration?

Your occasional reminder that the Orthodox magazines that claim to follow an editorial long set by “Torah leaders” repeatedly whitewash this cult of criminals. https://t.co/XY72NcCPR4
It is really hard to overstate how little discernment “Torah sages” actually have, and how many people suffer because they fall victim to the mistaken belief that knowing how to read ancient Jewish texts make you smarter.

@EladNehorai Gonna be lots more going through it when the #RogueSCOTUS opens the money floodgates to religious schools next month!
@EladNehorai Good for book sales in coming decades, except in states where they fall afoul of newly-Constitutional blasphemy laws.
@passwordismiket @ashleyfeinberg When a dinosaur loves a truck very much…
